d1.name: Ra
d1.description: King of the gods and ruler of the sun, sailing across the sky in his solar barque each day.

d2.name: Anubis
d2.description: Jackal-headed god of mummification and the afterlife, protector of the dead.

d3.name: Horus
d3.description: Falcon-headed sky god and protector of pharaohs, son of Osiris and Isis.

d4.name: Thoth
d4.description: Ibis-headed god of wisdom, writing, and knowledge, keeper of divine records.

d5.name: Bastet
d5.description: Cat goddess of protection, joy, and fertility, defender against evil spirits.

d6.name: Sobek
d6.description: Crocodile god of the Nile River, fertility, and military prowess.

d7.name: Khepri
d7.description: Scarab beetle god of rebirth and renewal, rolling the sun across the sky.

d8.name: Wadjet
d8.description: Cobra goddess and protector of Lower Egypt, symbol of royal power.

d9.name: Isis
d9.description: Goddess of magic, motherhood, and healing, devoted wife of Osiris.

d10.name: Osiris
d10.description: God of the underworld, death, and resurrection, judge of the dead.

d11.name: Seth
d11.description: God of chaos, storms, and the desert, brother and rival of Osiris.

d12.name: Nephthys
d12.description: Goddess of mourning and protection of the dead, sister of Isis.

d13.name: Ptah
d13.description: Creator god and patron of craftsmen and architects, creator through spoken word.

d14.name: Sekhmet
d14.description: Lion goddess of war and healing, fierce protector with the power to cure diseases.

d15.name: Hathor
d15.description: Cow goddess of love, music, and motherhood, nurturer of pharaohs.

p1.name: Pharaoh
p1.description: Divine ruler of Egypt, considered a living god and bridge between mortals and deities.

p2.name: High Priest
p2.description: Chief religious leader of temples, performing sacred rituals and maintaining divine order.

p3.name: Scribe
p3.description: Educated professional who could read and write, keeper of records and knowledge.

p4.name: Architect
p4.description: Master builder who designed pyramids, temples, and monuments for eternity.

p5.name: General
p5.description: Military commander leading armies to protect Egypt's borders and expand the empire.

p6.name: Physician
p6.description: Healer combining medical knowledge with magical practices to cure the sick.

p7.name: Embalmer
p7.description: Sacred craftsman who prepared the dead for the afterlife through mummification.

p8.name: Farmer
p8.description: Provider of food for Egypt, working the fertile Nile floodplains to feed the kingdom.

p9.name: Artisan
p9.description: Skilled craftsperson creating beautiful objects, jewelry, and artwork for nobles and gods.

p10.name: Merchant
p10.description: Trader who brought exotic goods from distant lands along trade routes.

p11.name: Vizier
p11.description: Chief minister and advisor to the Pharaoh, overseeing government administration.

p12.name: Oracle
p12.description: Sacred prophet who interpreted divine messages and foretold the future.

p13.name: Sailor
p13.description: Navigator of the Nile and Mediterranean, essential for trade and transportation.

p14.name: Mason
p14.description: Stone worker who carved hieroglyphs and built the great monuments of Egypt.

p15.name: Guardian
p15.description: Protector of sacred places and tombs, ensuring the eternal rest of the dead.

a1.name: Hippopotamus
a1.description: Powerful river beast of the Nile, feared for its strength and territorial nature.

a2.name: Lion
a2.description: King of beasts, symbol of royal power and divine strength in the desert.

a3.name: Elephant
a3.description: Massive creature from the southern lands, revered for its wisdom and memory.

a4.name: Gazelle
a4.description: Swift and graceful desert dweller, symbol of speed and elegance.

a5.name: Monkey
a5.description: Clever primate associated with Thoth, representing intelligence and mischief.

a6.name: Fish
a6.description: Sacred creatures of the Nile, providers of sustenance and fertility symbols.

a7.name: Goose
a7.description: Sacred bird of the Nile marshes, associated with creation myths and the soul.

a8.name: Bee
a8.description: Symbol of Lower Egypt and royal authority, creator of precious honey.

a9.name: Turtle
a9.description: Ancient creature of wisdom, carrying the weight of the world on its shell.

a10.name: Frog
a10.description: Symbol of rebirth and fertility, emerging from the Nile's life-giving floods.

a11.name: Vulture
a11.description: Sacred bird of Upper Egypt, protector goddess Nekhbet's earthly form.

a12.name: Owl
a12.description: Wise night hunter, guardian of hidden knowledge and ancient secrets.

a13.name: Ram
a13.description: Sacred animal of Amun-Ra, symbol of divine power and leadership.

a14.name: Giraffe
a14.description: Tall and graceful creature from the southern lands, reaching the heavens with its long neck.

a15.name: Jackal
a15.description: Desert scavenger and guide to the afterlife, servant of Anubis.

art1.name: Ankh
art1.description: Symbol of life and immortality, often held by gods and pharaohs.

art2.name: Eye of Horus
art2.description: Symbol of protection, royal power, and good health, associated with the sky god Horus.

art3.name: Sistrum
art3.description: Musical instrument used in religious ceremonies, associated with the goddess Hathor.

art4.name: Djed Pillar
art4.description: Symbol of stability and resurrection, often associated with Osiris.

art5.name: Cartouche
art5.description: Oval enclosure containing the hieroglyphic name of a pharaoh, protecting their identity for eternity.

art6.name: Canopic Jar
art6.description: Sacred vessel used to store the organs of the deceased during mummification.

art7.name: Scepter
art7.description: Rod of power and authority carried by gods and pharaohs as a symbol of divine rule.

art9.name: Pyramid
art9.description: Eternal tomb and gateway to the afterlife, built to last forever for the pharaohs.

art10.name: Solar Barque
art10.description: Sacred boat that carries the sun god Ra across the sky from dawn to dusk.

art11.name: Obelisk
art11.description: Tall stone pillar topped with a pyramid, reaching toward the heavens to honor the gods.

art12.name: Crook and Flail
art12.description: Royal regalia symbolizing the pharaoh's role as shepherd and protector of Egypt.

art14.name: Lotus Flower
art14.description: Symbol of rebirth and the sun, emerging pure from the muddy waters of the Nile.

art15.name: Uraeus Crown
art15.description: Royal headdress featuring the protective cobra, worn by pharaohs as divine protection.
